outcomes.info: The trees rustle from the wind as you lay on the ground. Your head aches with pain. You hear the crackling of fire beside you, its warm glow lighting the area. You are unsure of where you are, but you feel that you are not alone.
You wake up. Its still nighttime. Your head hurts a little less, but your body shivers from the cold. The fire lays dormant with only a few glowing embers remaining.
You get up and attend to the fire. The wind howls as you move the embers around. As the fire grows, your surroundings become more visible. Across the flames sits an old man with a pipe.

choices.info: Grab a stick as a weapon

outcomes.info: You frantically grab a big stick that lies beside you and raise it ready to swing. The old man tells you that is unnecessary with a little bit of a laugh.
You jump over the fire swinging the big stick like a madman. The old man yells out in pain as the stick hits his temple. The man slumps to the ground with his last breath saying: "why?"
"I have been given many names throughout the years, but you may call me Barteld if you wish. What is your name?" said the old man.
"You're just north of a small town called Marberín. I live out here by myself in a cabin east of us. Marberín is just a little to fast for me these days." said the old man.

choices.info: Ask "Will you take me in to town?"

outcomes.info: "Oh, so your name is Olivia? What a childish name. Anyways, I found this box near you with your name on it. It looks like it has a combination lock on it. Also I think you hit your head pretty good, or maybe you always looked like that. Do you think you can remember the combination?" said the old man.

"Oh, so your name is Jared? What a nice name. Anyways, I found this box near you with your name on it. It looks like it has a combination lock on it. Also I think you hit your head pretty good, or maybe you drank too much milk. Do you think you can remember the combination?" said the old man.

"Oh, so your name is Jason? What a fatherly name. Anyways, I found this box near you with your name on it. It looks like it has a combination lock on it. Also I think you hit your head pretty good, or maybe you just look like that normally. Do you think you can remember the combination?" said the old man.

"Oh, so your name is Angela? What a pretty name. Anyways, I found this box near you with your name on it. It looks like it has a combination lock on it. Also I think you hit your head pretty good. Do you think you can remember the combination?" said the old man.

"Oh, so your name is Emma? What a pretty name. Anyways, I found this box near you with your name on it. It looks like it has a combination lock on it. Also I think you hit your head pretty good, how many drinks did you have last night? Do you think you can remember the combination?" said the old man.
"Well, thats too bad... Is there anything I could help you with?" said the old man.

choices.info: Ask "Will you take me to the nearest town?"
Ask "Is there a place I could stay to rest?"

outcomes.info: You grab the pipe from the old man's body, scoff at him, and call him a stupid old fool. You take a few sips from the pipe and then laugh hysterically into the night sky.
You rip apart the poor old man with brute strength. As you carry out the deed, you lose what little sanity you had left. You swing the head around while dancing in circles and howling at the moon.
You look over the dead mans body.

You run away as fast as you can, unsure of your surroundings. The trees fly past you as you gain distance from the fire. You run for miles unsure of where to go. You come to a stop in front of a raging river.

You walk south with the old man. He rambles on about his distaste for what the town of Marberín has become. As you see the outline of the town approach, the old man stops. "This is as far as I go." says the old man.

choices.info: Say "Thank you for your help Barteld."
Say "Thanks for the rambling you old coot..."
Say nothing and head to the town
